p: EOPC potentiated the activity of Norfloxacin against S. aureus SA1199B overproducing NorA, as well as, against S. aureus K2068 overproducing MepA at subinhibitory concentrations. MIC values for Norfloxacin against SA1199B decreased eightfold in the presence of the oil from 64 to 8 µg/mL (Fig. 2A). For K2068 strain, MIC values for Norfloxacin also were reduced eightfold when the EOPC was added to the growth medium from 16 to 2 µg/mL (Fig. 3A). These results indicate that EOPC contains phytochemicals able to modulate the Norfloxacin resistance, probably by inhibition of the NorA and MepA efflux pumps.
